results.title: Who Does the Sentence?
results.creator_credit: Mark Laidler, Peter Johnson, Coburg State College and Victorian association for the care and resettlement of offenders
results.brief_description: When a person is taken into custody, the family of the offender serve “a sentence” of another kind. The Victorian Association for the Care and Rehabilitation of Offenders (VACRO) tries to help these families in its own individual fashion. The film is noted for scenes actually filmed in Pentridge

results.title: Glenn's story
results.creator_credit: Arnold Zable, Sue Dunstan and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: A documentary based on a story written by a 15 year old boy in the maximum security section of Turana. Discusses his childhood and the events which eventually lead to his becoming a ward of the state and finding himself on the wrong side of the law.

results.title: Lyrebird: master of mimicry
results.brief_description: Lyrebirds in Sherbrooke Forest in the Dandenong Ranges, Victoria. Shows the lyrebirds displaying their powers of mimicry - the sounds they emit are extremely varied and cover a large vocal range. Few animals call for such a long period. They imitate all the other birds of the forest, the whip bird, kookaburra, a flock of rosellas and many others. Also includes their own distinctive calls and dance.

results.title: Strange creature: the echidna
results.creator_credit: David Corke, Educational Media Australia and CSIRO
results.brief_description: A simplified version for schools and general audiences of the prize-winning CSIRO film “The Echidna”. Experienced naturalists have seen for the first time in this film the young echidna in its mother’s pouch at different stages of growth. Highlights its uniqueness as an egg-laying mammal and shows the echidna in its natural habitat, feeding, reproductive techniques and development of the young.

results.title: Leaf
results.brief_description: Captures the spirit of Autumn in the wilderness, by blending the elements of wind and leaf in a visually and rhythmically enchanting study of California’s Yosemite valley.

results.title: Your body during adolescence
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Health and Safety for You”.
Eighteen young people from thirteen to fifteen are shown to vary widely in size and shape, although all are changing from childhood to adulthood. The film mentions the general functions of the endocrine glands and the influence of the pituitary glands on growth changes, which may normally occur in any order. The structure and functioning of the male and female reproductive organs are outlined.

results.title: Waterfront safety
results.creator_credit: Western Australia. Dept. of Labour and Western Australian Government Film Unit
results.brief_description:
This 1966 film takes place on the wharfs and ships at Fremantle Harbour, demonstrating safe working methods for waterside workers. It shows the correct handling of various types of cargo, including logs, grain and phosphate mined from Nauru. It emphasises the use of protective clothing and equipment. The film also shows the prevention and control of fires, including fire fighting ships.

Produced by the Western Australian Government Film Unit and presented by the Western Australian Department of Labour with Accident Prevention Organisation (Shipping).

Please note: As this is an archival work, the content does not reflect current practice or standards. Professional advice for up-to-date safety practices should be sought from the appropriate contemporary authority.

results.title: Waistlines and lifelines
results.creator_credit: Russell Gibbs, John Banks and Advent Films
results.brief_description: Ron has a weight problem. He tries massage and the crash diet, but to no avail. A heart attack scare sends him to his doctor, who recommends graded exercises and consultation with a dietician.

results.title: The Vision of William Blake (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Guy Brenton, British Film Institute Experimental Film Fund and Morse Films
results.brief_description: Filmed in four museums that contain major collections of Blake’s writings and paintings, this documentary by Guy Brenton explores the anguish of Blake’s prophetic world, Music by Ralph Vaughan Williams, and narration and poems read by Bernard Miles and Robert Speight.
